skill.name: cost-optimization
skill.description: Optimize cloud costs through resource rightsizing, tagging strategies, reserved instances, and spending analysis. Use when reducing cloud expenses, analyzing infrastructure costs, or implementing cost governance policies.
skill.summary: Optimize cloud costs through resource rightsizing, tagging strategies, reserved instances, and spend...

security_audit.summary: No executable code, network access, or credential access was found. Content is instructional and aligns with cost optimization guidance.

content.user_title: Reduce cloud costs with proven strategies
content.value_statement: Cloud bills grow when resources are oversized or unmanaged. This skill provides clear steps to right-size, choose pricing models, and enforce cost governance.
actual_capabilities: Explain a visibility framework with tags, dashboards, and alerts
Outline right-sizing steps and idle resource removal
Compare reserved, savings plans, and spot pricing models
Suggest storage lifecycle policies and tiering
Describe multi-cloud cost tools and governance checks
limitations: Does not access live billing or usage data
Does not execute cloud API calls or Terraform
Requires user provided context to tailor recommendations

use_cases.title: Right-size a fleet
use_cases.description: Plan instance adjustments and autoscaling changes to cut waste.

use_cases.title: Build cost governance
use_cases.description: Define tagging, budget alerts, and review cadences.

use_cases.title: Reduce multi-cloud spend
use_cases.description: Identify pricing model and storage tier opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Starter cost review
prompt_templates.scenario: Small team with rising cloud costs
prompt_templates.prompt: List the first five actions to reduce AWS costs for a small web app. Keep steps short and actionable.

prompt_templates.title: Tagging strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a tagging standard for AWS, Azure, and GCP with required keys and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Pricing model choice
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare reserved instances, savings plans, and spot for steady EC2 workloads. Recommend a mix.

prompt_templates.title: Governance plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a cost governance plan with budgets, alerts, and weekly reviews for AWS, Azure, and GCP.

output_examples.input: Give me a quick plan to cut storage costs in AWS.
output: Enable S3 lifecycle transitions to Standard-IA after 30 days and Glacier after 90 days
Expire obsolete objects after 365 days where allowed
Review unused snapshots and delete stale ones
Set monthly storage budgets and alert at 80 percent

best_practices: Provide current resource types and usage patterns for accurate guidance
Adopt consistent cost allocation tags before optimization
Review savings plans and reserved options quarterly
anti_patterns: Requesting real billing data without providing access
Applying spot instances to stateful workloads without mitigation
Skipping tagging and expecting precise cost attribution

faq.question: Is this compatible with AWS, Azure, and GCP?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes guidance for all three providers and multi-cloud tooling.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides advice only and does not run cloud commands or access billing APIs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or CI tools?
faq.answer: It can suggest patterns, but you must apply changes in your tooling.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or billing data?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files, environment variables, or external services.

faq.question: What if my costs do not drop after changes?
faq.answer: Share usage context and constraints to refine recommendations and validate assumptions.

faq.question: How does this compare to cloud provider tools?
faq.answer: Provider tools give data; this skill helps interpret options and plan actions.
